alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 12 at 12:41PM PDT until August 13 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor tidal overflow of beaches and exposed parking lots around the times of the evening high tides. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Pooling of sea water is possible around the evening high tide at beach and harbor areas that is uncommon with normal tidal ranges. Enhanced beach erosion is also possible. No significant damage is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expected high tide is 7.0 feet at around 1020 PM PDT this evening. In addition, a long-period southerly swell near 2 feet will enhance the tidal overflow risk.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, as they can be deadly locations in such conditions.
